Title: Serge Gainsbourg's forgotten Ukrainian roots
Subhead: Serge Gainsbourg described himself as a Russian Jew. More precisely, his musician parents fled Tsarist Ukraine before emigrating to Paris in 1921, escaping pogroms and the Bolsheviks. In Ukraine, where four years of war have fueled an obsession with uncovering traces of the past, some have been trying to rediscover the singer's roots.

The rise of Polymarket, the cryptocurrency-based betting site for current events
Subhead: The American platform allows users to bet on the outcome of current events via cryptocurrencies. By early 2026, it has claimed tens of millions of visitors and hundreds of thousands of active traders.

Title: Karyna Shuliak was Jeffrey Epstein's last partner and main heiress. She won't benefit from his will
Subhead: The Belarusian woman met the sexual predator when she was 20 and remained loyal to him until his suicide in prison in 2019.

Title: Berlin film festival: Ilker Catak's 'Yellow Letters' wins the Golden Bear award
Subhead: The event, also known as the Berlinale, has been overshadowed this year by commentary, or lack thereof, on current politics and humanitarian crises.

Title: How a messianic movement is changing the Israeli military
Subhead: Followers of the Hardal movement, a blend of religious fundamentalism and ultranationalism, have begun to make inroads into the military establishment. Their dehumanizing rhetoric toward Palestinians has contributed to the destruction of the Gaza Strip.

Rebuked by Supreme Court, Trump touches limit of his power
Subhead: Trump's 'reciprocal' tariffs, a major aspect of his agenda, were struck down by the nation's highest court. He also faces mounting criticism over his handling of the Epstein affair and his immigration policy.

Title: Real or faux, vintage or new, fur is no longer hiding
Subhead: Even though imitation now dominates the market, secondhand pieces made from real fur are once again in high demand, as are sheepskin and lambskin. According to animal rights advocates, these alternatives still fuel the desire for materials that should be banned.

Title: Epstein files hand French prosecutors trove of new leads
Subhead: The Paris prosecutor's office opened two investigations on Wednesday: one into 'human trafficking' and the other regarding 'financial offenses such as money laundering, breaches of probity, or tax fraud.'
